author: Special Correspondent
text:
Following the pattern of the Aadhaar Bill, the Congress anticipates that the BJP government may table the contentious Goods and Services Tax (GST) Bill as the Money Bill after the constitutional amendments of the legislation are passed in the Upper House.

“Aadhaar cannot be a money Bill but GST can be,” said senior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh in a press conference. “After making the constitutional amendments, they [the BJP government] may bring GST as money Bill in the Lok Sabha.”

Mr. Ramesh said that by sidestepping the Rajya Sabha and passing the Aadhaar Bill in the Lok Sabha as money Bill, the BJP had violated the democratic tradition of discussing key legislation in Parliament.

Rejecting Finance Minister Arun Jaitley’s remarks on the GST, he said a significant number of BJP leaders did not want to pass the reform law; therefore, the ruling party was trying to make the Congress the “fall guy” for its non-passage.

“Gujarat is against GST, a large number of the trading community is against the GST. Many senior leaders of the BJP are against the GST,” said Mr. Ramesh. “So, it is not clear to me what voice the BJP is speaking with but they are using the Congress as a convenient excuse to justify their own inaction.”
title: GST Bill too may be introduced as money Bill, says Congress
